intro: Cocculus lanuginosus, commonly known as the hairy cocculus, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by round, green fruits containing smooth, black seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal medicine.
